intro: Munnozia chimboracensis, commonly known as the Chimborazo munnozia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. This species is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant is adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat, including strong sunlight and cool temperatures.
